description: Displays a list of currently running processes.
details: Shows all running processes with details like PID, memory usage. Use /v for verbose information and /fo for format.

description: Terminates tasks by process ID (PID) or image name.
details: Kills a running process. Use /F to force termination and /T to terminate child processes.

description: Displays network configuration details.
details: Shows IP address, subnet mask, and default gateway for all adapters. Use /all for detailed information and /release & /renew for DHCP.

description: Tests the reachability of a host on an IP network.
details: Sends ICMP Echo Requests to determine if a host is reachable and measures round-trip time. Use -t for continuous ping.

description: Traces the path packets take to a network host.
details: Displays the route and measures transit delays of packets across an IP network. Useful for diagnosing network issues.

description: Displays active network connections and listening ports.
details: Shows active TCP connections, ports on which the computer is listening, Ethernet statistics, and more. Use -a for all connections and listening ports.

description: Displays detailed configuration information about the computer and its operating system.
details: Provides information such as OS version, processor, memory, network adapters, and more. Useful for system diagnostics.

description: Scans and repairs system files.
details: Checks the integrity of all protected system files and replaces incorrect versions with correct Microsoft versions.

description: Checks the file system and file system metadata of a volume for logical and physical errors.
details: Verifies the file system integrity and fixes logical file system errors. Use /f to fix errors and /r to locate bad sectors.

description: Manages disk partitions.
details: A powerful utility for disk management. Allows creation, deletion, and resizing of partitions.

description: Formats a disk for use with Windows.
details: Prepares a disk for use by erasing all data and setting up a new file system. Use /fs to specify the file system type.

description: Clears the Command Prompt screen.
details: Removes all previous commands and outputs from the Command Prompt window.

description: Displays messages or turns command echoing on or off.
details: Can be used to display messages, or to control whether commands are displayed in the Command Prompt.

description: Displays or modifies file extension associations.
details: Shows or changes the file type associated with a particular file extension.

description: Compares two files or sets of files and displays the differences.
details: Used to find differences between files. Useful for comparing configuration files.

description: Searches for a text string in a file or files.
details: Looks for a specific text string within files. Use /c to count the number of lines containing the string.

description: Searches for patterns of text in files.
details: More powerful than 'find', supports regular expressions and multiple search patterns.

description: Manages power settings and configurations.
details: Allows users to configure power schemes, set sleep settings, and generate energy reports.

description: Schedules commands and programs to run periodically or at a specific time.
details: Enables creation, deletion, querying, and modification of scheduled tasks.

description: Performs network-related operations.
details: Includes various subcommands like net user, net share, net start, and net stop for managing users, shares, and services.

description: Displays or alters the encryption of directories and files on NTFS volumes.
details: Used to encrypt or decrypt files and folders. Common options include /E to encrypt and /D to decrypt.

description: Displays current device driver status and properties.
details: Lists all installed device drivers and their properties. Use /v for verbose output and /fo for format.

description: Performs tasks that are related to file systems or dismounts volumes.
details: Advanced utility for managing file systems, such as managing reparse points or querying free space.

description: Displays Group Policy information for a user or computer.
details: Generates a report on applied Group Policies. Use /h to create an HTML report.

description: Updates Group Policy settings.
details: Refreshes local and Active Directory-based Group Policy settings. Use /force to reapply all policies.

description: Displays the name of the current host.
details: Simply outputs the hostname of the machine.

description: Loads performance counters.
details: Used to load or unload performance counter settings from a specified file.

description: Manages and schedules performance logs and alerts.
details: Creates and manages Event Trace Session and Performance logs.

description: Displays NetBIOS over TCP/IP protocol statistics.
details: Provides detailed information about NetBIOS name tables and current connections.

description: Provides network latency and loss information.
details: Combines the functionality of `ping` and `tracert` to identify network issues.

description: Prints a text file.
details: Sends a text file to a printer. Limited to plain text files.

description: Changes the Command Prompt appearance.
details: Customizes the command prompt string. For example, `prompt $P$G` sets it to display the current path followed by `>`.

description: Saves the current directory and changes to a new one.
details: Pushes the current directory onto a stack and changes to the specified directory.

description: Restores the previous directory saved by `pushd`.
details: Pops the directory from the stack and changes to it.

description: Performs operations on the Windows registry.
details: Includes subcommands like `add`, `delete`, `query`, `copy`, `save`, `restore`, etc., for managing registry keys and values.

description: Robust file copy command with advanced features.
details: Supports copying files, directories, and subdirectories with options for mirroring, retrying, and logging.

description: Communicates with the Service Control Manager and services.
details: Used to create, start, stop, query, and configure Windows services.

description: Sets environment variables permanently.
details: Creates or modifies environment variables in the user or system environment.

description: Shuts down or restarts the computer.
details: Options include /s for shutdown, /r for restart, /t for timeout, and /f to force running applications to close.

description: Takes ownership of a file or directory.
details: Grants ownership of a file or folder to the current user, which can be necessary for modifying system files.

description: Graphically displays the directory structure of a drive or path.
details: Shows the folder hierarchy in a tree-like format. Use /f to display the names of the files in each folder.

description: Writes performance data to the command window or a log file.
details: Monitors and records performance counters in real-time.

description: Manages Driver Verifier, a tool for detecting driver problems.
details: Used to enable, disable, and configure Driver Verifier settings for testing drivers.

description: Manages Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) settings.
details: Includes operations like listing shadow copies, creating shadow copies, and deleting shadow copies.

description: Manages Windows Event Logs.
details: Used to query, archive, and clear event logs.

description: Manages Windows Remote Management.
details: Configures and manages remote management settings for Windows machines.

description: Manages Background Intelligent Transfer Service (BITS).
details: Used to create download or upload jobs, monitor job progress, and manage BITS settings.

description: Manages certificates and certificate services.
details: Performs various certificate operations, including creating, modifying, and verifying certificates.

description: Displays or alters the compression of files on NTFS partitions.
details: Used to compress or decompress files and directories. Use /c to compress and /u to uncompress.

description: Defragments a disk to improve performance.
details: Reorganizes fragmented data on a disk. Options include /A for analysis and /C to defragment all volumes.

description: Creates and manages shadow copies of volumes.
details: Used for advanced volume shadow copy management, including scripting shadow copy operations.

description: Enables or disables disk performance counters.
details: Used to activate or deactivate disk performance monitoring.

description: Manages the Windows driver store.
details: Handles driver packages, including adding, removing, and querying drivers in the store.

description: Recovers and maintains Extensible Storage Engine (ESE) databases.
details: Performs operations like defragmenting, repairing, and recovering ESE databases used by applications like Exchange.

description: Stops and restarts the Internet Information Services (IIS).
details: Used to restart IIS services. Options include /restart, /start, /stop, and /status.

description: Creates, deletes, or lists volume mount points.
details: Used to assign or remove mount points for volumes without assigning drive letters.

description: Sends messages to other users, sessions, or servers.
details: Used in networked environments to communicate with other users via the command line.

description: Opens the Notepad text editor.
details: Launches Notepad, optionally opening a specified file for editing.

description: Opens the Performance Monitor tool.
details: Launches the Performance Monitor GUI for tracking system performance metrics.

description: Registers or unregisters DLLs and ActiveX controls.
details: Used to register COM components. Use /u to unregister.

description: Opens the System Restore utility.
details: Launches the GUI for performing system restores to previous states.

description: Configures and analyzes system security.
details: Applies security templates, exports security settings, and analyzes system security.

description: Verifies that drivers are digitally signed.
details: Launches the Driver Signature Verification tool to check driver integrity.

description: Manages Windows licensing and activation.
details: Performs tasks like activating Windows, changing product keys, and displaying license information.

description: Connects to remote computers using the Telnet protocol.
details: Used for remote text-based communication. Note: Telnet is insecure and often disabled by default.

description: Displays or sets the system time zone.
details: Used to configure the time zone settings on the system.

description: Displays the current userâ€™s identity.
details: Outputs the username and domain of the currently logged-in user.

description: Copies files and directory trees.
details: More advanced than `copy`, supports copying directories and subdirectories. Use /E to include empty directories.

description: Locates and displays the path of files.
details: Searches for files in the directories listed in the PATH environment variable.

description: Launches a PowerShell session.
details: Starts PowerShell with optional parameters. Can execute scripts or commands directly.

description: Retrieves information about running processes.
details: Displays a list of all running processes with details like CPU and memory usage.

description: Retrieves the status of services on a local or remote machine.
details: Displays a list of services and their current status (running, stopped, etc.).

description: Changes the user preference for the PowerShell script execution policy.
details: Policies include Restricted, RemoteSigned, Unrestricted, etc., determining which scripts can run.

description: Imports a PowerShell module into the current session.
details: Loads additional cmdlets and functions from specified modules to extend PowerShell capabilities.

description: Creates a new file or directory.
details: Can be used to create files, folders, registry keys, etc., depending on the specified type.

description: Deletes files, directories, or other items.
details: Can remove various types of items. Use -Recurse to delete contents of directories.

description: Copies an item from one location to another.
details: Supports copying files, directories, and other items. Use -Recurse to copy directories recursively.

description: Moves an item from one location to another.
details: Moves files, directories, and other items. Can also be used to rename items.

description: Retrieves the content of a file.
details: Displays the contents of a text file line by line. Useful for reading logs and configuration files.

description: Writes or replaces the content in a file.
details: Overwrites existing content or creates a new file with the specified content.

description: Appends content to a file.
details: Adds new content to the end of an existing file without overwriting it.

description: Displays help information for PowerShell cmdlets and concepts.
details: Provides detailed documentation and examples for using cmdlets and features.

description: Retrieves all cmdlets, functions, workflows, aliases installed on the system.
details: Useful for discovering available commands and their details.

description: Displays the modules that are installed and loaded in the session.
details: Shows information about currently loaded modules or those available on the system.

description: Starts one or more processes on the local computer.
details: Can launch applications, scripts, or documents with specified parameters.

description: Stops one or more running processes.
details: Terminates processes by name or process ID. Use -Force to force termination.

description: Retrieves events from event logs on local or remote computers.
details: Can filter events by date, event ID, source, and more.

description: Deletes all entries from specified event logs.
details: Used to clear event logs. Requires administrative privileges.

description: Creates a new event log and a new event source.
details: Sets up custom event logs for applications and services.

description: Deletes an event log and its event sources.
details: Removes custom event logs created previously.

description: Gets the access control list (ACL) for a file or resource.
details: Displays permissions and ownership information for files, folders, and other resources.

description: Modifies the access control list (ACL) for a file or resource.
details: Applies new permissions or modifies existing ones for files, folders, and other resources.

description: Retrieves information about Active Directory users.
details: Requires the Active Directory module. Used to query user accounts and their properties.

description: Creates a new Active Directory user.
details: Requires the Active Directory module. Used to add new user accounts to AD.

description: Deletes an Active Directory user.
details: Removes user accounts from Active Directory.

description: Modifies properties of an Active Directory user.
details: Updates user attributes such as name, email, group memberships, etc.

description: Retrieves information about Active Directory groups.
details: Used to query group accounts and their properties in AD.

description: Creates a new Active Directory group.
details: Adds new group accounts to Active Directory.

description: Deletes an Active Directory group.
details: Removes group accounts from Active Directory.

description: Adds users or computers to an Active Directory group.
details: Adds specified members to a group in AD.

description: Removes users or computers from an Active Directory group.
details: Removes specified members from a group in AD.

description: Retrieves information about Active Directory computer accounts.
details: Used to query computer accounts and their properties in AD.

description: Restarts the operating system on a local or remote computer.
details: Includes options for specifying remote computers, delays, and forcing restarts.

description: Shuts down the operating system on a local or remote computer.
details: Includes options for specifying remote computers and forcing shutdowns.

description: Sends ICMP echo requests to test network connectivity.
details: Equivalent to `ping` in PowerShell. Can test multiple targets and provide detailed results.

description: Runs commands on local and remote computers.
details: Executes script blocks or commands on specified remote machines using PowerShell remoting.

description: Starts an interactive session with a remote computer.
details: Enters a remote PowerShell session for interactive command execution.

description: Ends a remote PowerShell session.
details: Closes the current interactive remote session and returns to the local session.

description: Exports data to a CSV file.
details: Converts objects into a series of comma-separated values and saves them to a file.

description: Imports data from a CSV file.
details: Reads a CSV file and converts each row into a PowerShell object.

description: Converts objects to JSON format.
details: Transforms PowerShell objects into JSON strings for data interchange.

description: Converts JSON strings to PowerShell objects.
details: Parses JSON strings and converts them into PowerShell objects.

description: Measures the time it takes to run a script or command.
details: Provides timing information for the execution of commands or script blocks.

description: Starts a background job.
details: Executes commands asynchronously in the background.

description: Retrieves background jobs.
details: Lists all background jobs running in the current session.

description: Gets the results of a background job.
details: Fetches the output produced by a completed background job.

description: Deletes a background job.
details: Removes specified jobs from the job list.

description: Suspends the activity in a script for a specified period.
details: Pauses execution for a given number of seconds or milliseconds.

description: Clears the PowerShell console screen.
details: Removes all previous commands and output from the console.

description: Sets the current working directory.
details: Changes the current directory to the specified path. Alias: `cd`.

description: Displays the current working directory.
details: Outputs the current directory path. Alias: `pwd`.

description: Sends HTTP and HTTPS requests to web pages or web services.
details: Used for web scraping, downloading files, or interacting with REST APIs.

description: Sends HTTP and HTTPS requests to RESTful web services.
details: Simplifies working with REST APIs by automatically parsing JSON and XML responses.

description: Creates a new property for an item (e.g., registry key).
details: Adds new properties to items such as files, registry keys, or other objects.

description: Modifies the value of an existing property of an item.
details: Updates properties of items like files or registry keys.

description: Gets the properties of an item.
details: Retrieves properties and their values for specified items.

description: Executes a string as a PowerShell expression.
details: Parses and runs the specified string as a PowerShell command.

description: Selects specific properties of an object or set of objects.
details: Used to filter and display specific properties from objects, often in combination with other cmdlets.

description: Sorts objects by property values.
details: Orders objects based on specified properties, supporting ascending or descending order.

description: Filters objects based on specified criteria.
details: Selects objects that meet the given condition, similar to the WHERE clause in SQL.

description: Performs an operation on each object in a pipeline.
details: Executes a script block for each object passed through the pipeline.

description: Calculates the numeric properties of objects.
details: Can compute counts, sums, averages, and other statistics on object properties.

description: Formats output as a table.
details: Organizes output data into a table layout, optionally adjusting column widths and formatting.

description: Formats output as a list of properties.
details: Displays each property on a separate line, useful for detailed views of objects.

description: Sends output to a file.
details: Redirects command output to a specified file, supporting encoding and append options.

description: Displays output in an interactive window.
details: Provides a GUI-based table view of data, allowing for sorting and filtering.

description: Sends output to null, effectively discarding it.
details: Suppresses output by directing it to a null destination.

description: Records all or part of a PowerShell session.
details: Begins logging all subsequent commands and output to a specified file.

description: Stops recording a PowerShell session.
details: Ends the transcript started by `Start-Transcript`.

description: Specifies which functions or variables to export from a module.
details: Controls the visibility of module members to users importing the module.

description: Imports commands from another session into the current session.
details: Brings in cmdlets, functions, aliases, and variables from a remote session.

description: Exports commands from a session to a module.
details: Creates a module containing cmdlets from a remote session for reuse.

description: Creates a persistent connection to a local or remote computer.
details: Establishes a session that can be used for running multiple commands remotely.

description: Closes and removes PowerShell sessions.
details: Terminates specified sessions to free up resources.

description: Retrieves information about active PowerShell sessions.
details: Lists all current sessions, both local and remote.

description: Configures the computer to receive PowerShell remote commands.
details: Sets up the necessary firewall rules and services for PowerShell remoting.

description: Disables PowerShell remoting on the computer.
details: Removes the configurations set by `Enable-PSRemoting` to prevent remote connections.

description: Gets the drives in the current session.
details: Lists all available drives (e.g., filesystem, registry, environment variables) in PowerShell.

description: Creates a new PowerShell drive.
details: Adds a new drive mapping to a data store, such as a network share or registry path.

description: Deletes a PowerShell drive.
details: Removes the specified drive from the current session.

description: Gets the providers available in the current session.
details: Lists all providers (e.g., FileSystem, Registry) that expose data stores to PowerShell.

description: Gets all breakpoints in the current session.
details: Lists all active breakpoints set for debugging scripts.

description: Sets a breakpoint in a script or function.
details: Defines a breakpoint at a specific line or condition within a script.

description: Removes a breakpoint.
details: Deletes specified breakpoints to stop pausing execution during debugging.

description: Disables a breakpoint without removing it.
details: Temporarily stops a breakpoint from pausing execution without deleting it.

description: Enables a previously disabled breakpoint.
details: Reactivates a disabled breakpoint to resume pausing execution.

description: Creates an instance of a .NET Framework or COM object.
details: Generates new objects for use in scripts, enabling access to .NET classes and COM components.

description: Opens or runs an item.
details: Launches files or applications as if they were double-clicked in Explorer.

description: Gets the item at the specified location.
details: Retrieves a single item (file, folder, registry key, etc.) from a specified path.

description: Searches for text and patterns in input strings and files.
details: Equivalent to `grep` in Unix, used for finding specific text within files.

description: Converts a path to its absolute form.
details: Resolves relative paths to their absolute, provider-specific equivalents.

description: Combines multiple strings into a single path.
details: Constructs valid file or directory paths by joining base and child paths.

description: Splits a path into its components.
details: Extracts specific parts of a path, such as the directory, file name, or extension.

description: Renames an item (file, folder, etc.).
details: Changes the name of a specified item without altering its location.

description: Creates a new alias for a cmdlet or executable.
details: Allows for shorthand or custom names for frequently used commands.

description: Retrieves all aliases or the alias for a specific cmdlet.
details: Lists all current aliases or details about a specific one.

description: Exports aliases to a file.
details: Saves current aliases to a file for backup or transfer to another system.

description: Imports aliases from a file.
details: Loads aliases from a previously exported file.

description: Displays the command history.
details: Lists all commands entered during the current PowerShell session.

description: Clears the command history.
details: Removes all recorded commands from the session history.

description: Executes commands from the session history.
details: Runs a previously entered command based on its history ID.

description: Adds commands to the session history.
details: Manually inserts commands into the history list.

description: Controls script debugging features.
details: Enables or disables script tracing and step-by-step execution for debugging purposes.

description: Starts a trace of commands and modules.
details: Monitors the execution of specified commands or modules, useful for debugging.

description: Exports an object to an XML file.
details: Serializes objects into XML format, preserving their structure and properties.

description: Imports an object from an XML file.
details: Deserializes objects from XML files back into PowerShell objects.

description: Retrieves the value of a variable.
details: Displays the value and properties of specified variables in the session.

description: Sets the value of a variable.
details: Creates or modifies variables with specified values.

description: Deletes a variable from the session.
details: Removes specified variables, freeing up memory and preventing further use.

description: Resets a variable to its default value.
details: Empties the value of a variable without removing it from the session.

description: Gets all breakpoints in the current session.
details: Lists all active breakpoints set for debugging scripts.

description: Sets a breakpoint in a script or function.
details: Defines a breakpoint at a specific line or condition within a script.

description: Removes a breakpoint.
details: Deletes specified breakpoints to stop pausing execution during debugging.

description: Disables a breakpoint without removing it.
details: Temporarily stops a breakpoint from pausing execution without deleting it.

description: Enables a previously disabled breakpoint.
details: Reactivates a disabled breakpoint to resume pausing execution.

description: Creates an instance of a .NET Framework or COM object.
details: Generates new objects for use in scripts, enabling access to .NET classes and COM components.

details: Launches files or applications as if they were double-clicked in Explorer.

details: Retrieves a single item (file, folder, registry key, etc.) from a specified path.

details: Constructs valid file or directory paths by joining base and child paths.

details: Extracts specific parts of a path, such as the directory, file name, or extension.

details: Changes the name of a specified item without altering its location.

details: Allows for shorthand or custom names for frequently used commands.

details: Loads aliases from a previously exported file.

details: Lists all commands entered during the current PowerShell session.

details: Removes all recorded commands from the session history.

description: Executes commands from the session history.
details: Runs a previously entered command based on its history ID.

description: Adds commands to the session history.
details: Manually inserts commands into the history list.

description: Controls script debugging features.
details: Enables or disables script tracing and step-by-step execution for debugging purposes.

description: Starts a trace of commands and modules.
details: Monitors the execution of specified commands or modules, useful for debugging.

description: Exports an object to an XML file.
details: Serializes objects into XML format, preserving their structure and properties.

description: Imports an object from an XML file.
details: Deserializes objects from XML files back into PowerShell objects.

description: Retrieves the value of a variable.
details: Displays the value and properties of specified variables in the session.

description: Sets the value of a variable.
details: Creates or modifies variables with specified values.

description: Deletes a variable from the session.
details: Removes specified variables, freeing up memory and preventing further use.

description: Resets a variable to its default value.
details: Empties the value of a variable without removing it from the session.

details: Lists all active breakpoints set for debugging scripts.

details: Defines a breakpoint at a specific line or condition within a script.

description: Removes a breakpoint.
details: Deletes specified breakpoints to stop pausing execution during debugging.

details: Temporarily stops a breakpoint from pausing execution without deleting it.

description: Enables a previously disabled breakpoint.
details: Reactivates a disabled breakpoint to resume pausing execution.

details: Launches files or applications as if they were double-clicked in Explorer.

details: Retrieves a single item (file, folder, registry key, etc.) from a specified path.

details: Equivalent to `grep` in Unix, used for finding specific text within files.

details: Resolves relative paths to their absolute, provider-specific equivalents.

description: Combines multiple strings into a single path.
details: Constructs valid file or directory paths by joining base and child paths.

description: Splits a path into its components.
details: Extracts specific parts of a path, such as the directory, file name, or extension.

description: Renames an item (file, folder, etc.).
details: Changes the name of a specified item without altering its location.

description: Creates a new alias for a cmdlet or executable.
details: Allows for shorthand or custom names for frequently used commands.

description: Retrieves all aliases or the alias for a specific cmdlet.
details: Lists all current aliases or details about a specific one.

description: Exports aliases to a file.
details: Saves current aliases to a file for backup or transfer to another system.

description: Imports aliases from a file.
details: Loads aliases from a previously exported file.

description: Displays the command history.
details: Lists all commands entered during the current PowerShell session.

description: Clears the command history.
details: Removes all recorded commands from the session history.

description: Executes commands from the session history.
details: Runs a previously entered command based on its history ID.

description: Adds commands to the session history.
details: Manually inserts commands into the history list.

description: Gets the current call stack.
details: Displays the sequence of function calls that led to the current point in execution.

description: Gets the event subscribers in the current session.
details: Lists all active event subscriptions for handling events.

description: Registers for an event on a .NET object.
details: Sets up an event handler to respond to specific events triggered by objects.

description: Unsubscribes from an event.
details: Removes event subscriptions to stop handling specific events.

description: Retrieves management information from local and remote computers.
details: Queries WMI classes to obtain detailed system information.

description: Calls a WMI method on a local or remote computer.
details: Executes methods defined in WMI classes for system management tasks.

description: Gets CIM (Common Information Model) instances from a local or remote computer.
details: Similar to `Get-WmiObject` but uses the CIM standard for better interoperability.

description: Invokes a method on a CIM instance.
details: Executes CIM methods for system management, similar to WMI methods.

description: Creates a new CIM session for remote management.
details: Establishes a session to perform CIM operations on remote computers.

description: Deletes CIM sessions.
details: Closes and removes specified CIM sessions to free resources.

description: Retrieves information about active CIM sessions.
details: Lists all current CIM sessions, both local and remote.

description: Registers for CIM indication events.
details: Sets up event handlers for CIM events, allowing real-time monitoring of system changes.

description: Unregisters CIM indication events.
details: Removes previously registered CIM event subscriptions.

description: Retrieves the current date and time.
details: Displays the current system date and time. Can be formatted or manipulated as needed.

description: Sets the system date and time.
details: Updates the system's date and time settings. Requires administrative privileges.

description: Generates a new globally unique identifier (GUID).
details: Creates a new GUID, useful for unique identifiers in scripts and applications.

description: Generates a random number or selects random objects.
details: Can produce random integers, select random elements from collections, and more.

description: Checks whether a path exists.
details: Returns `True` if the specified path exists; otherwise, `False`.

description: Converts a path to its absolute form.
details: Provides the full path of a relative or ambiguous path.

description: Combines multiple strings into a single path.
details: Constructs valid file or directory paths by joining base and child paths.

description: Splits a path into its components.
details: Extracts specific parts of a path, such as the directory, file name, or extension.

description: Renames an item (file, folder, etc.).
details: Changes the name of a specified item without altering its location.

description: Creates a new alias for a cmdlet or executable.
details: Allows for shorthand or custom names for frequently used commands.

description: Retrieves all aliases or the alias for a specific cmdlet.
details: Lists all current aliases or details about a specific one.

description: Exports aliases to a file.
details: Saves current aliases to a file for backup or transfer to another system.

description: Imports aliases from a file.
details: Loads aliases from a previously exported file.

description: Displays the command history.
details: Lists all commands entered during the current PowerShell session.

description: Clears the command history.
details: Removes all recorded commands from the session history.

description: Executes commands from the session history.
details: Runs a previously entered command based on its history ID.

description: Adds commands to the session history.
details: Manually inserts commands into the history list.

description: Controls script debugging features.
details: Enables or disables script tracing and step-by-step execution for debugging purposes.

description: Starts a trace of commands and modules.
details: Monitors the execution of specified commands or modules, useful for debugging.

description: Exports an object to an XML file.
details: Serializes objects into XML format, preserving their structure and properties.

description: Imports an object from an XML file.
details: Deserializes objects from XML files back into PowerShell objects.

description: Retrieves the value of a variable.
details: Displays the value and properties of specified variables in the session.

description: Sets the value of a variable.
details: Creates or modifies variables with specified values.

description: Deletes a variable from the session.
details: Removes specified variables, freeing up memory and preventing further use.

description: Resets a variable to its default value.
details: Empties the value of a variable without removing it from the session.

description: Gets all breakpoints in the current session.
details: Lists all active breakpoints set for debugging scripts.

description: Sets a breakpoint in a script or function.
details: Defines a breakpoint at a specific line or condition within a script.

description: Removes a breakpoint.
details: Deletes specified breakpoints to stop pausing execution during debugging.

description: Disables a breakpoint without removing it.
details: Temporarily stops a breakpoint from pausing execution without deleting it.

description: Enables a previously disabled breakpoint.
details: Reactivates a disabled breakpoint to resume pausing execution.

description: Creates an instance of a .NET Framework or COM object.
details: Generates new objects for use in scripts, enabling access to .NET classes and COM components.

description: Opens or runs an item.
details: Launches files or applications as if they were double-clicked in Explorer.

description: Gets the item at the specified location.
details: Retrieves a single item (file, folder, registry key, etc.) from a specified path.

description: Searches for text and patterns in input strings and files.
details: Equivalent to `grep` in Unix, used for finding specific text within files.

description: Converts objects to HTML format.
details: Transforms PowerShell objects into an HTML table for web display.

description: Converts HTML content to PowerShell objects.
details: Parses HTML content and converts it into structured PowerShell objects.

description: Creates a compressed archive file.
details: Compresses specified files and folders into a .zip archive.

description: Expands a compressed archive file.
details: Extracts the contents of a .zip archive to a specified folder.

description: Sends output to the default formatter.
details: Ensures that output is displayed in the console when output is redirected or piped.

description: Converts objects to strings.
details: Formats objects as strings, often used when output needs to be treated as text.

description: Sends output to a printer.
details: Prints the output of commands directly to a specified printer.

description: Writes information messages to the information stream.
details: Provides informational messages that can be captured or displayed based on preference settings.

description: Sends output to a file.
details: Redirects command output to a specified file, supporting encoding and append options.

description: Displays output in an interactive window.
details: Provides a GUI-based table view of data, allowing for sorting and filtering.

description: Sends output to null, effectively discarding it.
details: Suppresses output by directing it to a null destination.
